SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Process Deprecated Apex Classes and Visualforce Pages

Keep your org data lean and tidy by removing unused or deprecated Apex classes and Visualforce pages.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: The deprecated files no longer control any default functionality or have any dependencies in the managed package. To free up available space in your org, these files are removed from the managed package.

How: Upgrading the managed package automatically removes the following deprecated Apex classes from your org:

cc_api_Wishlist	cc_ctrl_test_CouponAdmin	PaypalAddressInfo
cc_api_WishlistTest	cc_ctrl_test_CouponCloneButton	PaypalAddressInfoTest
cc_ctrl_CouponAdmin	cc_dao_Wishlist	PaypalPayerInfo
cc_ctrl_CouponCloneButton	cc_dao_WishlistTest	PaypalPayerInfoTest

The following Apex classes are deprecated, but not automatically removed. The classes remain in your org after you upgrade, but don't control any functionality.

c_if_api_PageLabel	cc_dao_iOutboundOrder	cc_excn_AccountGroupNotFoundException
cc_api_PageLabel	cc_excn_AccountGroupDuplicatedException	cc_excn_test_All
cc_api_test_PageLabel	cc_excn_AccountGroupException	cc_hlpr_PaymentSvcFactory

Upgrading the managed package automatically removes the following deprecated Visualforce pages from your org:

cc_admin_downloadCustomSettings
cc_admin_PriceListItemTiers
cc_admin_Schema
cc_admin_Schema2Excel
cc_tmpl_Catalog
logger_LoggerSetup
NOTE Sometimes, the pages remain in your org after upgrade completes. If you notice that these pages remain, you can safely delete these pages manually.
IMPORTANT If you’re upgrading from B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) or earlier, the removal of these Visualforce pages can result in an error that indicates that the package upgrade is blocked. To resolve this issue, complete the following steps:
First, upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12), which typically doesn’t require any extra configuration or compatibility steps. Complete the steps in Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (Version 4.12).
When you receive the email notification that the upgrade has completed, proceed with upgrading to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13). Complete the steps in Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (Version 4.13).

Finally, the managed package updates the following default profiles and permission sets to remove these classes and pages. Update the clones of these profiles and permission sets that you've previously created to account for these changes:

B2B Commerce Admin permission set
B2B Commerce Guest permission set
B2B Commerce Lockdown Guest permission set
B2B Commerce Community User profile defined in the managed package, which you assign to the custom storefront user profile that you created during setup

Install the B2B Commerce for Visualforce Managed Package

title: Removing Deprecated Apex Classes and Visualforce Pages in B2B Commerce
